metadata.dc:title: FABP4, endothelial function and carotid intima-media thickness in cardiovascular risk patients
metadata.dc:description: Objective: Adipocyte fatty acid binding protein (FABP4) plasma levels are higher in type 2 diabetes(T2D), obesity and metabolic syndrome. Endothelial dysfunction is a common feature in the development of vascular diseases associated with metabolic disturbances. We have investigated the relationship between circulating FABP4 levels and endothelial function in patients at cardiovascular risk. Methods: Two hundred and fifty-seven patients (mean age, 57.29±10.66 years) at increased cardiovascular risk (CVR). Fasting plasma FABP4 levels were measured. La disfunción endotelial es una característica común en el desarrollo de las enfermedades vasculares asociadas a las alteraciones metabólicas. El objetivo del trabajo es estudiar la relación entre FABP4 circulante y la función endotelial en pacientes con elevado riesgo cardiovascular (RCV).Métodos: Doscientos cincuenta y siete pacientes (57,29±10,66 años) con RCV incrementado.
